noteParagraph.text: Definitions for Section C:
Alkali metals: Li, Na, K, Rb, Cs, Fr
Alkaline earth metals: Ca, Sr, Ba, Ra
Lanthanides: elements with atomic numbers 57 to 71 inclusive
Rare earths: Sc, Y, Lanthanides
Actinides: elements with atomic numbers 89 to 103 inclusive
Refractory metals: Ti, V, Cr, Zr, Nb, Mo, Hf, Ta, W
Halogens: F, Cl, Br, I, At
Noble gases: He, Ne, Ar, Kr, Xe, Rn
Platinum group: Os, Ir, Pt, Ru, Rh, Pd
Noble metals: Ag, Au, Platinum group
Light metals: alkali metals, alkaline earth metals, Be, Al, Mg
Heavy metals: metals other than light metals
Iron group: Fe, Co, Ni
Non-metals: H, B, C, Si, N, P, O, S, Se, Te, noble gases, halogens
Metals: elements other than non-metals
Transition elements: elements with atomic numbers 21 to 30 inclusive, 39 to 48 inclusive, 57 to 80 inclusive, 89 upwards

titlePart.text: ANIMAL AND VEGETABLE OILS, FATS, FATTY SUBSTANCES AND WAXES
THE USE OF SINGLE SUBSTANCES AS DETERGENTS

noteParagraph.text: In this sub-class, it is desirable to add, in conformity with paragraph 80 of the Guide, after the double oblique stroke the symbols relating to complementary information concerning individual constituents of a technical subject which is already classified as such. This complementary information concerns the indication of the ingredients of compositions classified in the mixture groups of groups .

titlePart.text: Detergent compositions based essentially on surface-active compounds
Use of these compounds as a detergent

noteParagraph.text: In groups , a compound is classified in the last appropriate place.

titlePart.text: Polycarboxylic acids containing no nitrogen or sulphur
Sulphonic acids or sulphuric acid esters
derived from aliphatic hydrocarbons or mono-alcohols
derived from divalent or polyvalent alcohols
containing ester or ether groups directly attached to the nucleus
Sulphonation products derived from fatty acids or their derivatives, e.g. esters, amides
Mixtures of compounds all of which are anionic
Ethers of polyoxyalkylenes with amino alcohols
Condensation products of epoxyalkanes with amines
Esters of carboxylic acids with amino alcohols
Esters of amino carboxylic acids with alcohols
Derivatives of urea, thiourea, cyanamide, guanidine or urethanes
Mixtures of compounds all of which are cationic
Mixtures of anionic with cationic compounds
of sulphonated products with alkylolamides of carboxylic acids
Oxidation products of paraffin wax, other than acids
Ethers of polyoxyalkylenes having mixed oxyalkylene groups
Carboxylates or sulphonates of polyoxyalkylene glycols
Neutral esters of acids of phosphorus
Derivatives of lignin containing no sulpho- or sulphate groups
Mixtures of compounds all of which are non-anionic
Mixtures of non-ionic with anionic compounds
of sulphonates with ethers of polyoxyalkylenes without phosphates
Mixtures of non-ionic with cationic compounds
Mixtures of anionic, cationic, and non-ionic compounds
Mixtures with anionic, cationic or non-ionic compounds
Other compounding ingredients of detergent compositions covered in group

noteParagraph.text: In groups , a compound is classified in the last appropriate place.

titlePart.text: and with alkylolamides of carboxylic acids
in a mixture with alkylolamides of carbocyclic acids
in admixture with ethers of polyoxyalkylenes
Heterocyclic compounds containing nitrogen in the ring
Vegetable products, e.g. soya meal, wood flour, sawdust
Compositions of detergents based essentially on non-surface-active compounds

noteParagraph.text: In the absence of an indication to the contrary, in groups a compound is classified in the last appropriate place.

titlePart.text: Products in which the composition is not well defined
Compositions of detergents based essentially on soap
containing compounding ingredients other than soaps

ipcEntry.remark: after note due to endsymbol scope

noteParagraph.text: In groups , a compound is classified in the last appropriate place.

titlePart.text: Products in which the composition is not well defined
Compositions of detergents, not provided for by one single preceding group
based on mixtures of surface-active non-soap and non-surface-active compounds
based on mixtures of surface-active non-soap compounds and soap
based on mixtures of non-surface-active compounds and soap
Special methods for preparing compositions containing mixtures of detergents
Preparation in the form of powder by spray-drying
by chemical means, e.g. sulphonating in the presence of other compounding ingredients followed by neutralising
Making of soap or soap solutions in general
Bleaching of soap or soap solutions
in the form of small particles, e.g. powder, flakes
Slicing soap on the cooling drum
Recovery of soap, e.g. from spent solutions
Manufacture of resin soap or soaps derived from naphthenic acids
Compositions containing resin soap or soap derived from naphthenic acids
Detergent materials characterised by their shape or physical properties
combined with or containing other objects
Recovery of glycerol from a saponification liquor
